====Principles common to all psychotherapies====
Common definition :

- Therapeutic technique using psychic processes

Points in common:

- Theoretical model of the psyche

- Therapeutic framework: objective, duration, tools, limits, etc.

- Quality psychotherapist/patient relationship or therapeutic alliance

- Patient involvement

- Defined intervention process

- Behavioural, cognitive and affective learning

question.title: What is a common principle underlying all psychotherapies?

option_a.title: The therapeutic technique using only cognitive processes

option_b.title: The theoretical model of the psyche and the therapeutic relationship
option_b.description: A fundamental principle of all psychotherapies

option_c.title: Patient involvement and defined intervention process
option_c.description: A common aspect of psychotherapies, but not a principle

option_d.title: Behavioural learning only
option_d.description: A narrow view of psychotherapies, neglecting cognitive and affective aspects

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
